p: PREO-based formulations indicated antibacterial activity against four bacteria species in the following order of decreasing inhibitory: LC 90, optimized nanoemulsions, and LC 50 ( Table 5). Overall, the optimized formulations showed better antibacterial activity in the individual interaction mode compared to the LC 50 and in the combined mode compared to the LC 50 and temephos (Pâ‰¤0.01). Also, in the combined interactions, the performance of the optimized formulations was similar to that of LC 90. Details on the growth inhibition of bacteria exposed to different concentrations of PREO formulations are presented in the Table 5.
